`UseShellExecute` is not supported on .NET Core because it is only MTA.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
~~Additionally, `UseShellExecute` defaults to true, so all direct uses of `Process.Start` are incorrect for CoreCLR PowerShell.~~

While the [documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/api/system.diagnostics.processstartinfo#System_Diagnostics_ProcessStartInfo_UseShellExecute) states this fact; the code reveals a [different fact](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/d0dc5fc099946adc1035b34a8b1f6042eddb0c75/src/System.Diagnostics.Process/src/System/Diagnostics/ProcessStartInfo.Windows.cs#L52).

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @daxian-dbw, @mirichmo This ports `Invoke-Item` and `Get-Help -Online` to CoreCLR PowerShell on Windows. Please take the changes back into SD, or at least ensure the work doesn't get duplicated. Also please review and sign-off.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
There is no Nano powershell team anymore, there is only one powershell team now.
For this one, you can revert back the FullCLR powershell implementation, and throw PlatformNotSupportedException only for CoreCLR-Windows build. Then open an issue to me to fix the CoreCLR-Windows behavior including NanoServer/IoT.
But in your future code changes, please also take the NanoServer/IoT scenario into consideration. We are contributing to an open source project, so our code changes/check-ins should cover all scenarios of the project.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
LGTM except for some minor comments and the failed CI build.
Please remember to open an issue for the CoreCLR-windows behavior and assign it to me.
I will ping Raghu and Quoc on IM to ask them take a look.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @daxian-dbw the failing build is due to Travis updating the OS X images, and is unrelated to these changes. I'm currently investigating. Thanks for the review.

title: Fix use of UseShellExecute for .NET Core
